sentences.english: We will be growing our hair into backcombed bunches and glossing our lips scarlet
sentences.chinese: 把頭髮用梳子倒梳，猩紅脣色王道。
有的，不過只有猩紅色的了。

sentences.english: She caught scarlet fever before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節前她得了猩紅熱病。

sentences.english: In some areas, red earth produces dramatic scarlet-hued tornadoes.
sentences.chinese: 在有一些地方，紅色的地球製造猩紅色的龍捲風。

sentences.english: The color of the curtains clashes with the color of the carpet .
sentences.chinese: 這猩紅色的地毯中和了你的窗簾的顏色。

sentences.english: Hives and scarlatina are good hair at children.
sentences.chinese: 麻疹和猩紅熱都好發於兒童。

sentences.english: He also contracted scarlet fever, which almost killed him.
sentences.chinese: 他還感染過猩紅熱，並幾乎要了他的小命。

sentences.english: Two broad verandahs built around an interior terrance trimmed in scarlet.
sentences.chinese: 周圍的岩層建成兩個室內裝飾中廣泛走廊猩紅。

sentences.english: A goblin stands guard here, dressed in a uniform of scarlet and gold.
sentences.chinese: 一個穿着一身猩紅鑲金制服的妖精站在這裏守衛。

sentences.english: He did not wear his scarlet coat.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有穿他的猩紅外套。

sentences.english: Should notice to have in addition without take medical history, with except scarlatina appearance drug rash.
sentences.chinese: 此外應注意有無服藥史，以除外猩紅熱樣藥疹。

sentences.english: Devastation over the world, bloodred sky burning the humans below.
sentences.chinese: 破敗遍佈世界，猩紅的天空炙烤着下方的人類。

sentences.english: It looks as if it's scarlet fever.
sentences.chinese: 看起來這好像是猩紅熱。

sentences.english: Mary was quarantined for several weeks when she had scarlet fever.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗得猩紅熱時被隔離了幾個星期。

sentences.english: After nearly 2 months of rest, my scarlet Gloxinia started blooming today.
sentences.chinese: 休息了兩個月，我的猩紅色大巖桐今天又開始開花了。

sentences.english: Her eyes were scarlet and swollen from crying and her face dissolved into tears.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛猩紅熱和腫脹，並從她的臉哭溶解到眼淚。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
silvery light/bright white light/shining white light
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
